There is a limitation on GitHub which prevents me from simply providing a link that you can click on to install styles found here. You also can't simply use the "Install from URL" feature in Stylish to install my styles here (specifically, Stylish requires that any style be served with an HTTP header which states that the document is a text/css type whereas GitHub serves the raw files with the text/plain attribute.)

The methods you can use to install my styles are:

1.
I have them uploaded to Userstyles.org, where you can simply click on a button to install them. The styles are can be found:
Red theme:		https://userstyles.org/styles/115983/global-black-for-amoled-red-theme
Dark red theme:	https://userstyles.org/styles/115984/global-black-for-amoled-dark-red-theme


2.
If you can't or don't want to use Userstyles, you have to open Stylish's entry in Firefox's about:addons page, click/tap on the "Manage Styles" button, click/tap on the "Install from URL" button then copy-paste one of the following links into the dialogue box that appears:
Red theme:		data:text/css;charset=utf-8;base64,
Dark red theme:	data:text/css;charset=utf-8;base64,

Do note that this method only works for the mobile version of Firefox; the desktop version will not accept these URLs because it considers them security risks.


3.
If you can't or don't want to use Userstyles AND you're using the desktop version of Firefox, you may copy-paste a link to the raw CSS files into one of these two websites then use the URL they provide with the above mentioned "Install from URL" method:
https://rawgit.com/
https://raw.githack.com/

I don't support this method of installing my styles though; I'm only informing you that it is a possibility.
